entries.s_ecfd8a1: Relax. I'm not saying you were.
entries.s_ea090abe: I'm not the bartender. Go ask Gil.
entries.s_e288626b: There's really nothing left for me now. I haven't had any time to figure out my next move. I'm thinking that I'm going to need to pick up a job with the shuttle services... and that's going to be horrible!
entries.s_d31921cd: You realize you are in Bestine, right? Do you know where to find the starport so you can get out of here... right away?!
entries.s_cc070e7b: I am a free pilot, myself.
entries.s_c8d0555c: I don't want to fly a TIE fighter.
entries.s_c88254be: I'm here to see Gil Burtin.
entries.s_c6667cfa: Well, I'm... Hmm. Let me think...
entries.s_b5ff56cf: Then I don't know what you're doing here. Gil only refers pilots to CorSec and RSF. There's no work to be found here on Tatooine anymore, my friend. None whatsoever...
entries.s_b3aefb70: Shut down by order of the Empire! I guess they don't want anybody fooling around in space unless they fly a TIE fighter for the Imperial Navy!
entries.s_b0cc84d1: The Empire has installed military jurisdiction over the galactic transit services. It's a special oversight group that sets flight schedules, repair budgets, and so forth. It's a nightmare!
entries.s_ab39b18c: In the old days, a transport pilot was never allowed to run more than two shifts back-to-back. Now, the Empire's oversight plan has pilots running as many as they can handle. A Zabrak buddy of mine logged more than a dozen shifts in a row just last week!
entries.s_9f74e2fc: Then you'll probably want to see Gil. He's in the lounge, playing bartender.
entries.s_8d4beebb: Then I think you should talk to Gil. He can direct you to CorSec or the Royal Security Forces. You won't have to fly a TIE fighter, I can assure you!
entries.s_89553663: Oh dear. How can so many people be so wrong...?
entries.s_877a4502: I don't think you appreciate the sort of safety violations that are running rampant through the transportation service!
entries.s_7d00c660: He's in the lounge, playing bartender for this little party. Between us, I think he's been drowning his sorrows a bit between pilot interviews. Don't let that stop you, though. He was the founder of the Free Pilots Guild, after all. I can only imagine how this has affected him.
entries.s_7c525a54: I agree... but what can anyone do?
entries.s_75f774fd: Are you looking for the Free Pilots Guild? I have what you might describe as a 'good news, bad news' situation.
entries.s_6e54c48b: What are you doing here then?
entries.s_61129613: There is no Free Pilots Guild any more. Bad enough for you?
entries.s_5ad17cbf: Oh. Good. Wonderful! There's no heartbreaking shame in that, now is there? No filthy guilt eating your brain away, right?
entries.s_54818bbc: I don't know what you mean.
entries.s_53d912d: The good news... the good news... let me see. Now that I think about it, I lied. This is a 'bad news' situation. You a pilot?
entries.s_49c76620: Tell me where I can find Gil.
entries.s_426a2f78: Wow. You sound rich, my friend. Stay that way.
entries.s_2d1ee89c: No kidding! But, what can one person do about it? I'll tell you: nothing.
entries.s_26256229: Right... except for the fact that the Empire is also taking a substantial chunk of credits out of your pay to support their blasted war effort!
entries.s_2174cfc4: I know, but what can you do?
entries.s_1fbaff94: And that's not all! The equipment is suffering just as much. Most transports are supposed to receive regular maintenance four times each cycle... but I know of a few here in Bestine that haven't seen maintenance for over nine months!
entries.do_not_edit: The English version of this file (privateer_broker_retired_pilot.stf) is automatically generated by the SwgConversationEditor.
